thread.title: Bus, train or car? Getting around on the day of Wales v Fiji
thread.title_full: Bus, train or car? Getting around on the day of Wales v Fiji | Wales - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Bus, train or car? Getting around on the day of Wales v Fiji
text:
Wales take on Fiji at Cardiff's Millennium Stadium later today and thousands of fans are expected to attend.
Credit: PA Kick-off is at 16.45 and the match should end around 18.30, clashing with Cardiff's usual rush hour.
Whether you're heading to the match, or just trying to get home from work, you may need to plan ahead.
Here's what you need to know if you're traveling by:
Bus: Cardiff Bus' Unite union members are on strike until Friday night, so the operator will be running some limited and special services.
Anyone traveling in and around the city is advised to check timetables and routes for any changes here .
For getting into Cardiff, there'll be additional spaces at Park and Ride sites across the city:
400 extra at Blackweir and 500 at Leckwith/Cardiff WestPark. The Park and Ride sites will be open from 11:45 and stay open until 22:30.
You can book a space here .
Train: Arriva has scheduled some extra trains to Bristol Temple Meads, London and Newport after the final match whistle.
There's also a shuttle bus service from Cardiff to Bristol Parkway.
Fans are advised to buy their tickets in advance andnot to wait until the last train to get home as many other fans are expected to do the same.
Arriva Trains Wales has also put together an improved queuing system at Cardiff Central Rail Station:
Arriva Trains Wales @ArrivaTW Follow Here's the queuing system that will be in place at Cardiff Central after #WALvFJI tomorrow http://t.co/p8MwBzsxNT http://t.co/6kZx0Tw6Z1
16:30 - 30 Sep 2015 Retweet Reply Favourite Car: The key travel advice to fans is to travel early and if driving, arrive by mid-afternoon (14:00) to avoid commuter traffic.
Anyone driving in can make use of the extra Park and Ride spaces mentioned above.
There are some council run spaces within the city, but these are likely to fill up early.
Read more: Warnings over Rugby World Cup travel disruption Last updated Thu 1 Oct 2015 Travel Wales Cardiff
